title: Teen shot in face in Dover
content:
A 17-year-old boy was hospitalized Monday night after getting shot in the face in Dover, an official said.
Officers responded to the 1400 block of S. Farmview Drive just after 7:20 p.m. for a report of shots fired, said Cpl. Mark Hoffman, a spokesman for the Dover Police Department.
While investigating the incident, police were told that the victim had turned up at Bayhealth Kent General Hospital for treatment, Hoffman said.
The boy was wounded by a shotgun shell containing numerous pellets. His injuries are not life threatening, Hoffman said.
Additionally, a home on the street was also damaged by gunfire, Hoffman said.
The motive behind the shooting is still under investigation. Anyone with information into the gunfire can call the Dover Police Department at 736-7130. Tips can also be submitted to Delaware Crime Stoppers at 1-800-TIP-3333 or online at www.tipsubmit.com or through the Dover Police Department's MyPD mobile app.
